title: `X-XSS-Protection` header has not been set at  app.passit.io

profile.name: Passit
profile.about: An open source app that uses an established and modern cryptographic library to secure your passwords online so you can access them anywhere.

vulnerability_information:
Hi

`X-Xss-Protection` at  app.passit.io has not been set.

## Impact

This header is used to configure the built in reflective XSS protection found in Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (Webkit). Valid settings for the header are 
0, which disables the protection, 
1 which enables the protection and 1; mode=block which tells the browser to block the response if it detects an attack rather than sanitising the script.

#Checking 

```
curl -i -s -k  -X 'GET' \
    -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)' \
    'https://app.passit.io/'
```


#Fix
 add_header `X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block`
 
#Ref 
- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-XSS-Protection
- https://www.keycdn.com/blog/x-xss-protection/

Regards

activities.message: Thanks for the report. It's seems a bit ambiguous if this is really useful or not in modern browsers. So def low priority.

activities.message:
Learning towards keeping it as is

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-XSS-Protection

Enables XSS filtering (usually default in browsers). If a cross-site scripting attack is detected, the browser will sanitize the page (remove the unsafe parts). 

Facebook notably disables it as it shouldn't be relied on.

Passit only supports modern browsers so the default would be enabled without block.

activities.message:
https://blog.innerht.ml/the-misunderstood-x-xss-protection/ is an interesting blog on the topic. 

I decided to just turn it on (1; mode=block). There is some disagreement but just have to pick an option. If 1; mode=block is good enough for Google it's good enough for me.

This will show up in the next release see https://gitlab.com/passit/passit-backend/commit/fe8a6e01d615ae7d987d8775bb952d7cc0c575e1
